title: The full-stack PM | Anuj Rathi (Swiggy, Jupiter Money, Flipkart)
key_insights: Users are lazy, vain, and selfish - design onboarding experiences with this mindset
Product managers should be full-stack influencers, thinking beyond features to entire user journeys
Always explore three divergent strategic options before committing to one direction
Focus on new/marginal users rather than existing users when optimizing experiences
Most experiments should be thought experiments - many will obviously fail with proper analysis
In marketplaces, traditional OKRs fail because goals across user types are inherently conflicting
Excellence over speed when forced to choose - think more and ship better
Product managers need three core skills: raw smarts, drive/grit, and influence

guest_background.current_role: Chief Product and Marketing Officer at Jupiter Money

topics_discussed: Product management evolution in India since 2010
Building for diverse Indian market with multiple languages and price sensitivities
Lazy, vain, selfish user framework for onboarding design
Show don't tell methodology for product planning
Working backwards process with three alternative PR FAQs
Four BB framework: Brilliant Basics, Bread and Butter, Big Bets, Breaking Bad
Rule of three for strategic alternatives
Marketplace complexity and three-way user dynamics
Can't do, won't do, not set up to do leadership framework
Product manager skill assessment and career fit
memorable_quotes: There are only three reasons why things do not happen the way you want them to happen as a leader. You can look at a person, and you would say either that person can't do, which is a capability issue, or they won't do, which is a motivation or an alignment issue, or they were not set up to do, which is really your problem.
Users are lazy, they are vain, and they're selfish. So lazy meaning, 'I don't have time for this, so blow my mind away. Otherwise, I'm not going to pay attention.'
You are the reason for your own misery. Stop externalizing.
frameworks_mentioned: Working backwards with PR FAQ methodology
Four BB framework (Brilliant Basics, Bread and Butter, Big Bets, Breaking Bad)

Can't do, won't do, not set up to do leadership assessment

recommended_for: Professionals interested in Indian market dynamics
PMs working on user onboarding and activation
Product strategists and heads of product
summary: Anuj Rathi shares battle-tested frameworks from building successful Indian marketplaces like Swiggy and Flipkart, emphasizing full-stack product management, user-centric design for 'lazy, vain, selfish' users, and strategic thinking through multiple alternatives. The conversation provides concrete methodologies for product strategy, marketplace dynamics, and leadership in complex product environments.
